  • Transfer USDC from Axelar to Provenance using Osmosis

Transfer USDC from Axelar to Provenance using Osmosis

danger

This is just an alpha draft of this process. Will repeat process with an account that folks can inspect, including explorer links, etc. Please send feedback to Vdub.

Any token or asset in the Cosmos ecosystem can be transferred between Cosmos-based blockchains through IBC (the Inter-Blockchain protocol), provided that a relayer is running to transport messages between any two chains.

The Osmosis DEX (Decentralized EXchange), running on top of the Osmosis blockchain, acts as a source of liquidity and interchange for many cryptocurrencies.

In this tutorial, we'll show you how to transfer the stablecoin USDC from the Axelar Network to Provenance using the Osmosis DEX and the Keplr Wallet.

Axelar is currently the only provider of USDC on Osmosis (as of November 2022), and the version of USDC available is an Axelar-wrapped token called AXLUSDC. However, Axelar and Circle have announced that within the next few months, a native, non-wrapped version of USDC will be available on Osmosis.

The Token Flow​

For the convenience of this guide, we're going to transfer some Provenance HASH to Osmosis and swap it for USDC. Alternatively, one could purchase USDC on public exchanges, such as Coinbase or Binance, and then transfer them to Osmosis.

Once we have USDC, we will also need some OSMO coin (the native token for the Osmosis blockchain) to be able to pay for the gas fee for the IBC transfer from Osmosis to Provenance.

1. Set Up a Keplr Wallet​

Keplr is a non-custodial (you hold your own keys) blockchain wallet that works well with Osmosis and other Cosmos-based blockchains.

For this exercise, the Chrome Extension version of the Keplr Wallet is most convenient.

  1. Install and open the Keplr Wallet Chrome Extension

  2. Do not create a new account. Instead, choose to Import existing account so that you can use the Keplr wallet with your existing Provenance account

  1. Make sure to switch the seed input from the default 12 words to 24 words to match your Provenance Blockchain mnemonic length

2. Connect Keplr to Provenance Blockchain​

Next, we need to connect your Keplr Wallet to the Provenance Blockchain. This YouTube video describes two alternative methods for connecting your Keplr Wallet to Provenance using either:

  • Restake or
  • Osmosis Frontier Zone


Verify it worked:

Once you have your Keplr Wallet connected to Provenance, verify that your Provenance account address shown in the Keplr Wallet is correct, and that your Provenance tokens are available as expected.

PLACEHOLDER IMAGE:

3. Transfer Hash to Osmosis​

We're now going to transfer some Hash from the Provenance Blockchain to the Osmosis Blockchain over IBC. Go to the Osmosis Frontier Zone and click on Assets on the left side of the screen.Frontier

Use the Asset Search form to find HASH on Provenance Blockchain, then click on Deposit


Connect your Keplr wallet, then choose how much Hash you wish to transfer.


4. Swap Hash for USDC​

Now that your Hash is sitting on the Osmosis blockchain, you can use the Osmosis DEX to swap Hash for USDC. Click on Swap on the left-hand side menu of the Osmosis Frontier Zone.

In the Swap form, choose HASH/Provenance for the first coin and USDC/Axelar for the second.

Approve the swap, and now you have USDC!

5. Swap Hash for OSMO​

The IBC transfer of USDC from the Osmosis chain to the Provenance chain incurs a gas fee that must be paid in OSMO, so repeat step 4, this time swapping some Hash for OSMO token.

6. Transfer USDC to Provenance​

Now we're ready to transfer your USDC over to Provenance Blockchain using your Keplr Wallet. Open your Keplr Wallet Chrome Extension and find the IBC Transfer button:

For your first IBC transfer to Provenance, you'll need to specify the channel over which the transfer will occur.


Select "Provenance" as the destination chain, using "channel-222"

You'll need to specify your account address on the Provenance Blockchain as the destination for the transfer. You can copy the text of your address by clicking on your Provenance address (starting with "pb1...") from the Provenance chain view in your Keplr Wallet:

Your transfer destination configuration will look like this:

TODO: screenshot of actual final send operation

FINALLY

USDC will show up in Explorer as a generic IBC token type (until the protocol team finishes the implementation to add metadata to IBC denoms).destination Here's the view of the USDC in Explorer currently:
